question: When did P.V. Narasimha Rao unveil the ‘Look East Policy’?
option1: In Singapore, through his lecture in September 1994.
option2: In January 1992, when India became dialogue partner of ASEAN
option3: In 1995, on the occasion of India’s elevation as ‘full dialogue partner of ASEAN
option4: Through MEA Annual Report for the year 1995-96
answer: In Singapore, through his lecture in September 1994.
explanation: In September 1994, India’s ‘Look East Policy’ was officially defined and articulated by Prime Minister Narasimha Rao in his Singapore lecture. He had stressed the point that India’s historical and cultural relations were very old and strong and there was nothing new in India looking towards reinforcing cooperative linkages with its eastern neighbors.
